attributes.action: Cut council costs for the right to place a headstone on graves
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to cut costs for the right to place a headstone, this should be free. Buying a headstone is expensive and a council placing this cost adds costs to a deceases family and shown no respect for the dead. People have already paid for the rights to the grave and placing a costs on the right to place a headstone is a way for the council to try and profit.
attributes.background: Milton Keynes council and many other councils around the UK place a cost on the right to "Place a headstone on a grave". In Milton Keynes this is £750-£1000. In Daventry this is £3000! the council should not profit from a persons death, when that person has paid council tax all their life.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This would be a matter for individual local councils.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
